model_solution:
To find the total area of the gray figure, calculate the area of each square and then subtract the areas of the three triangles formed by the overlap. The area of each square is $6^2=36$ square units.
The area of each triangle is $\frac12\cdot6\cdot3=9$ square units.
There are three overlapping triangles with area 9 square units each. 
There are three overlapping triangles with area 9 square units each.
The total area of the gray figure is $3\cdot 36-3\cdot 9=108-27=81$ square units.
Subtract the areas of the three triangles from the total area of the three squares.
Subtract the areas of the three triangles from the total area of the three squares.
